description: Take your chicken to the next level with this easy Korean fried chicken recipe. Learn how to make the crispiest chicken coated in a delicious sticky sauce.
name: Korean Fried Chicken Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Place sauces, sugar, sesame oil and half the garlic in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes or until sugar has dissolved. Bring to the boil, reduce heat to low, then simmer for 4 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Meanwhile, combine vinegar and remaining garlic in a large bowl. Season well. Cut each chicken thigh into 3 pieces and add to bowl, mixing to coat. Place cornflour in a large, shallow bowl.

Place enough oil in a wok to come 2cm up sides of wok and heat over mediumhigh heat until hot. Coat 4 chicken pieces in cornflour. Shake off excess cornflour, then add chicken to wok and cook for 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Repeat twice more with remaining chicken and cornflour.
Transfer chicken to a serving dish. Drizzle over sauce mixture, then serve sprinkled with onion and sesame seeds.
